intro: Mollinedia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed mollinedia, is a rare and unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mollinedia longipes is considered a species of conservation concern.
